column4: hi everyone... wireshark is not working in my ubuntu.. its not listing the interfaces.. whereas in windows its showing the realtek and i am able to use it... whats the problem here?
thanx a lot.. can you also tell me how can i see the list of all urls which are open in my browser on terminal?
I don't know of an easy way to do that

That's info that firefox holds (you could edit the source to print it for you).  Otherwise you'll have to capture the packets when the connects to those urls are made.  There will be a hailstorm of packets
: how can i edit the source and fro where?
No offense but if you don't know where to get source you aren't going to be able to edit it :)
ok you mean the source code?
ok that i know.. so what changes do i need to do ... like what command so that it will print on the terminal?
That's the hard part.  It would take me too much time to figure it out.  Sorry, on your own here.  What is the ultimate goal here?
i just wanna write a bash script to show all urls opened.. just a curiosity
:i just wanna write a bash script to show all urls opened.. just a curiosity
Perhaps you'll be lucky and that is already printed out in some debugging info or something.
can you suggest me a tutorial or something?
i tried to look for it but didnt get anything
man firefox    would be a good starting point
